channel.title: Python's Ideas for Dropping the "Global Interpreter Lock"
channel.description:
Python's C implementation (CPython) parallels the classical Redbol world in many ways. So some of what they talk about here may be applicable:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/18CXhDb1ygxg-YXNBJNzfzZsDFosB5e6BfnXLlejd9l0/edit#

item.title: Python's Ideas for Dropping the "Global Interpreter Lock"
item.dc:creator: hostilefork
item.description:
Python's C implementation (CPython) parallels the classical Redbol world in many ways. So some of what they talk about here may be applicable:

docs.google.com

Python Multithreading without GIL

Multithreaded Python without the GIL Sam Gross colesbury@gmail.com / sgross@fb.com Source code: https://github.com/colesbury/nogil The goal of this project is to remove the global interpreter lock (GIL) from CPython to enable multiple threads to...

Read full topic
item.source: Python's Ideas for Dropping the "Global Interpreter Lock"
